revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 04:53:53.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: I2f61f9767882c74b7fb7b54ec890a5c1b8f03aaf
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: I2f61f9767882c74b7fb7b54ec890a5c1b8f03aaf

commit_message:
show all release notes in list-changes

If the release request includes a diff-start instruction, use that as
the starting point for release notes instead of the most recent tag.

Change-Id: I8a4f78366bfc19d667057629fb9f772aaa6b2ff9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
change propose-library-branches to use yamlutils

We now have a way to preserve the order and other general formatting
settings when rewriting a YAML file, so use it instead of tacking a
blob of text onto the end of the file.

Change-Id: Icd3a6a4d75e3e86acbec66503f4b99951460c2f7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Don't persist could-be-stale InstanceGroup fields in RequestSpec

Not only might these be stale, but they can also be very large, especially
if InstanceGroup.members has a lot of peer instance uuids. This can overrun
a 64kb TEXT field and cause a failure.

Related-Bug: #1738094

Change-Id: Ie70c77db753711e1449e99534d3b83669871943f
(cherry picked from commit 94fd36f0582c5dbcf2b9886da7c7bf986d3ad5d1)

commit_message:
Don't persist could-be-stale InstanceGroup fields in RequestSpec

Not only might these be stale, but they can also be very large, especially
if InstanceGroup.members has a lot of peer instance uuids. This can overrun
a 64kb TEXT field and cause a failure.

Related-Bug: #1738094

Change-Id: Ie70c77db753711e1449e99534d3b83669871943f
(cherry picked from commit 94fd36f0582c5dbcf2b9886da7c7bf986d3ad5d1)

commit_message:
Handle exception on adding secgroup

If user adds security group to an instance and the instance already
has that security group, neutron will return a 400 response. Nova
should handle the 400 response properly. In before, Nova doesn't
seem to handle this case and end-user gets a 500 response. This
commit fixed it.

Conflicts:
      nova/network/security_group/neutron_driver.py

NOTE(hongbin): The conflict is due to the removal of translation of
log messages.

Closes-Bug: #1691274
Change-Id: I58b19ef6b537d690df90e542b6af3c64773ecc87
(cherry picked from commit 083bc89f99e007c400b9f89c63ac0459da910df8)

Document subnet_service_types extension in api-ref

Adding sub-section for the extension, request params and
json response

Closes-Bug: 1733396

Signed-off-by: Michal Kelner Mishali <mkelnermishal@vmware.com>

subject: Remove the static_physical datasource from the recommended 'types' list
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-30 10:09:14.000000000', 'message': "Remove the static_physical datasource from the recommended 'types' list

We should deprecate the static_physical datasource in Rocky. In the
meantime, remove it from the 'types' list in the documentation.
Also removed nagios, which is still supported but was not tested for a
long time.

Change-Id: Ifa2d3f9b4af9be9ac02cc303acd6074f168a1462
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the static_physical datasource from the recommended 'types' list

We should deprecate the static_physical datasource in Rocky. In the
meantime, remove it from the 'types' list in the documentation.
Also removed nagios, which is still supported but was not tested for a
long time.

Change-Id: Ifa2d3f9b4af9be9ac02cc303acd6074f168a1462

commit_message:
Remove redundant import alias

This patch remove redundant import aliases and add pep8 hacking function
to check no redundant import aliases.

Co-Authored-By: Dao Cong Tien <tiendc@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I3207cb9f0eb4b4a029b7e822b9c59cf48d1e0f9d
Closes-Bug: #1745527

commit_message:
Remove glance api_servers from nova config

This should now be able to be discovered from the service catalog,
there is no reason to set it.

Change-Id: I7383b589fbcef9423beeab735db42c594f7b56fd
get auth from context for glance endpoints:
Depends-On: I4e755b9c66ec8bc3af0393e81cffd91c56064717

placement API.  On success, the local ProviderTree cache is updated

method, because the placement API does not yet support generations on
aggregate associations.  That work is forthcoming.

commit_message:
SchedulerReportClient.set_aggregates_for_provider

Introduce SchedulerReportClient.set_aggregates_for_provider, which
accepts a provider UUID and list of aggregates to push back to the
placement API.  On success, the local ProviderTree cache is updated
appropriately.  On failure, an exception is raised.

Note that generation conflicts are not handled in this iteration of this
method, because the placement API does not yet support generations on
aggregate associations.  That work is forthcoming.

Change-Id: I4a7d4c1f3caaebebdb38ae04c5f85e57ec967852
blueprint: nested-resource-providers

commit_message:
Remove the addtion of a second router

A router gets created in order to link the provisioning and
tenant networks. Move its creation and use it instead of the
provisioning-router.

Change-Id: I3dee3dd94a4925858238d9da23a59220fb9f2713

commit_message:
Use native Zuul v3 tox job

Replace tox-genconfig legacy job with native Zuul v3 job.

Also, remove name from project stanza, this is not needed anymore.

One more typo.'}, {'account_id': 18955, 'date': '2018-01-19 04:48:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19457, 'date': '2018-01-19 05:35:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27405, 'date': '2018-01-19 05:46:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-19 05:51:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27349, 'date': '2018-01-19 05:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19457, 'date': '2018-01-19 06:04:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18955, 'date': '2018-01-19 10:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-01-19 10:58:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

According to our experience the amount of this kind of patches raises when we are getting closer to a summit, a PTG, or elections. I think everyone understands why.

I formally can't be against of such patches (especially given that they fix issues) but I'd like to ask you to make more changes. For example, if you want to fix a typo, please go over the entire document and fix ALL typos in the doc. Or you can go over all docs, all cod comments etc."}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-01-19 10:59:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Regardless of my comment, +2.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-01-31 11:43:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-27 07:46:02.000000000', 'message': "Add default configuration files to data_files

In order to make it simpler to use the default configuration files
when deploying services from source, the files are added to pbr's
data_files section so that the files are included in the built wheels
and therefore deployed with the code. Packaging and deployment tools
can then more easily use the default files if they wish to.

This pattern is already established with similar
files for neutron and the glance metadefs as has
been mentioned in the related bug report.

Change-Id: I1c609ebc2e8a6fd011463e31baca0d75a3ebf998
Closes-Bug: #1718356
"}, {'created': '2017-09-27 08:55:01.000000000', 'message': "Add default configuration files to data_files

"}, {'created': '2017-10-09 02:25:05.000000000', 'message': "Add default configuration files to data_files

In order to make it simpler to use the default configuration files when
deploying services from source, the files are added to pbr's data_files
section so that the files are included in the built wheels and therefore
deployed with the code. Packaging and deployment tools can then more
easily use the default files if they wish to.

This pattern is already established with similar files for neutron and
the glance metadefs as has been mentioned in the related bug report.

deploying services from source, the files are added to pbr's data_files
section so that the files are included in the built wheels and therefore
deployed with the code. Packaging and deployment tools can then more
easily use the default files if they wish to.

the glance metadefs as has been mentioned in the related bug report.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I71245b1c551f93e36d2b8b4212d804770edc6ed5

commit_message:
Remove mongodb container image

mongodb has been retired from RDO dependencies repo in queens [1]
so mongodb container images need to be removed from the list of
images to build and pull.

[1] https://lists.rdoproject.org/pipermail/dev/2018-January/008518.html

Change-Id: I730a134f01c90de7b886ef6dbda50c52c5ec09bb
Closes-Bug: #1745687

commit_message:
remove threshold alarms

ceilometer-api is gone. NOTE: CEILOMETER IS NOT GONE. JUST THE API.
use gnocchi or something else for storage if required.

Change-Id: Ie37eaaa0abd8b0cf530895bcedd55c9370d3e558

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ib4cc4e577619685db404bf34c16ae599d5e1fb35

commit_message:
enable single PUT of multiple shard ranges to container servers

Make container server PUT a/c request accept a body with json
serialized list of shard range updates so that we can update several
shard ranges 'atomically'.

For time being, retain support for a PUT a/c/o with headers describing
a single shard range in case it is still needed.

Drive-by remove spurious x-size header from shard range updates.

Change-Id: Iab21a48426199bc4eee74f503407e87774479381
